meta.content: Students will be challenged to become college and career ready and life-long learners. The El Rancho Unified School District will actively partner with the community as its leading educational institution that provides a technology rich and innovative learning environment for all students.

div.div: To read the entire article please use the link: http://www.cashnet.org/uncategorized/governors-executive-order-and-impacts-on-school-construction-projects/

ERUSD will be providing free bags of fresh produce to residents of the community beginning Tuesday, April 14, 2020 from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Pickup locations will be at STEAM Academy @Burke, Rivera Middle School, and North Park Academy of the Arts. This will continue until supplies run out.

h3.a: Parent Update on School Closure - Campuses to be Closed for the Remainder of the School Year

div.div:
Student, staff and family safety is our number one priority. Be advised that State health officials have made it clear that the safest place to be is home during the COVID-19 pandemic. With that in mind, our campuses will remain physically closed for the remainder of the school year. Our decision aligns with the recommendation from Los Angeles County Superintendent of Schools, Dr. Debra Duardo, as she has stated, “that schools remain physically closed for the rest of the academic year.”
Read more . . . .

WHY YOU SHOULD PARTICIPATE Your participation will ensure that our students, educators, and community members receive the resources they need. Our community has a lot to gain. Each person counted in the census means more money will go to our community for the next 10 years for things like schools, roads, hospitals and healthcare.
Read more . . .
This is a message from El Rancho Unified School District in regards to the Coronavirus (COVID-19).

Location: Public comments for both agendized and non-agendized items can be submitted on Tuesday, April 21, 2020 starting at 4:30 p.m. and will remain open until 6:30 p.m. https://forms.gle/rYn4qESrVZYdn4kd7
Individuals wishing to address the Board may call (669) 900-9128, Meeting ID: 938 6775 1243.
